}} 'Hyperion' (18 April 1930 – 9 December 1960) was a British bred
Thoroughbred, a dual classic winner and an outstanding sire. Owned by Edward
Stanley, 17th Earl of Derby, Hyperion won Â£29,509 during his career - a
considerable sum at the time. His victories included the Epsom Derby and St.
Leger Stakes.

Hyperion was by the wartime Triple Crown winner and good sire Gainsborough and
his grandsire was Bayardo. His dam, Selene, was by Chaucer, a talented son of
the undefeated St. Simon. Selene was also dam of such good sires as Sickle (sire-
line ancestor of Native Dancer and Sea Bird II) Pharamond (US), and Hunter's
Moon (Argentina). He was inbred in the third and fourth generation to St. Simon.
Hyperion was trained at Newmarket to win his classics by George Lambton. Leicester, Sir Charles, âBloodstock Breedingâ, J.A. Allen & Co,
